How would I place modprobe in my path, so that I don't have to 'su -' the next time that I want to do that?

try looking in /etc/profile, to change the default path.. alternatively you can add to the $PATH variable with export.. export PATH=$PATH:/usr/sbin .. that change will only hang around until you exit the shell though
also pretty sure a reboot is required for changes to /etc/profile to take effect. not sure about that though
